sen.j: 淀（よど）は京都市伏見区西南部に位置する地域。
sen.e: Yodo is an area located in the southwestern part of Fushimi Ward Kyoto City Kyoto Prefecture.
Yodo is an area located in the southwestern part of Fushimi Ward Kyoto City Kyoto Prefecture.
Yodo is an area located in the southwestern part of Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: カンマを追加しました。

sen.j: 淀川と桂川 (淀川水系)に挟まれた場所にある。
sen.e: It is an area sandwiched between the Yodo-gawa River and the Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System).
It is an area sandwiched between the Yodo-gawa River and the Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System).
It is an area sandwiched between the Yodo-gawa River and the Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system).
sen.cmt: system 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 江戸時代は城下町（淀城）であり、また宿場町（淀宿）でもある交通の要衝であった。
sen.e: During the Edo Period, it was a castle town (of Yodo-jo Castle) and was an important traffic point as a post station.
During the Edo Period, it was a castle town (of Yodo-jo Castle) and was an important traffic point as a post station.
During the Edo period, it was a castle town (of Yodo-jo Castle) and was an important traffic point as a post station.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 現在も京都府道・大阪府道13号京都守口線や京阪本線が淀を通っているものの通過点に過ぎず、むしろ競馬のメッカ（京都競馬場）として知られている。
sen.e: Although the Kyoto Prefecture Road /Osaka Prefecture Route No. 13, Kyoto Moriguchi Line and the Keihan Main Line run in the area today, they only pass through it, and it is rather famous for a Mecca for horse race fans (JRA Kyoto Race Course).

Although the Kyoto Prefecture Road /Osaka Prefecture Route No. 13, Kyoto Moriguchi Line and the Keihan Main Line run in the area today, they only pass through it, and it is rather famous as a Mecca for horse race fans (JRA Kyoto Race Course).

Although the Kyoto Moriguchi Line of Kyoto Prefecture Route /Osaka Prefecture Route 13 and the Keihan Main Line run in the area today, they only pass through it, and it is rather famous as a Mecca for horse race fans (JRA Kyoto Race Course).

sen.j: 1589年（天正17年） - 茶々（淀殿）が淀城（後年の淀城とは違う場所と言われる）に入る。
sen.e: In 1589, Chacha (Yodo-dono) moved to the Yodo-jo Castle (which is said to be different from what was built later.)
In 1589, Chacha (Yodo-dono) moved to the Yodo-jo Castle (which is said to be different from what was built later.)
1589: Chacha (Yodo-dono, or Lady Yodo) moved to the Yodo-jo Castle (which is said to be different from what was built later.)
sen.cmt: 淀殿の補足を追加しました。「"On"を使わない日付+半角コロン+半角スペース+文章」の形式に変更しました。

sen.j: 1619年（元和5年） - 淀宿が設置。
sen.e: In 1619, Yodo-juku Station was established.
In 1619, Yodo-juku Station was established.
1619: Yodo-juku Station was established.

sen.j: 1623年（元和9年） - 廃藩となった伏見藩にかわって淀藩が立藩。
sen.e: In 1623, Yodo clan was established by taking over the defunct Fushimi clan.
In 1623, Yodo clan was established by taking over the defunct Fushimi clan.
1623: Yodo clan was established by taking over the defunct Fushimi clan.

sen.j: 1623年（元和9年） - 淀城（新淀城）が築城される。
sen.e: In 1623, New Yodo-jo Castle (Shin-yodo-jo Castle) was built.
In 1623, New Yodo-jo Castle (Shin-yodo-jo Castle) was built.
1623: New Yodo-jo Castle (Shin-Yodo-jo Castle) was built.

sen.j: 1868年（慶応4年）1月 - 鳥羽・伏見の戦いで、敗走した幕府軍が淀藩へ助けを求めるが拒絶。
sen.e: In 1868, the army of Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), which had been defeated in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, ran away to the Yodo clan for help but was rejected.
In 1868, the army of Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), which had been defeated in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, ran away to the Yodo clan for help but was rejected.
January 1868: The army of Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), which had been defeated in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, ran away to the Yodo clan for help but was rejected.
sen.cmt: 同上1月 を追加しました。

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）10月1日 - 淀池上町、淀下津町、淀新町が合併し、久世郡淀町として町制施行。
sen.e: On October 1, 1889, Yodo-ikegami-cho, Yodo-shimozu-cho, and Yodo-shin-machi were merged to established as Yodo-cho Kuse-gun.
On October 1, 1889, Yodo-ikegami-cho, Yodo-shimozu-cho, and Yodo-shin-machi were merged to establish Yodo-cho Kuse-gun.
October 1, 1889: Yodo-ikegami-cho, Yodo-shimozu-cho, and Yodo-shin-machi were merged to establish Yodo-cho, Kuse-gun by implementing the chosei (grant of town status).
sen.cmt: 同上町制施行 を追加しました。

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）12月1日 - 現在の京都競馬場が開設。
sen.e: On December 1, 1925, today's JRA Kyoto Race Course opened.
On December 1, 1925, today's JRA Kyoto Race Course opened.
December 1, 1925: Today's JRA Kyoto Race Course opened.

sen.j: 1935年（昭和10年）4月1日 - 綴喜郡美豆村を編入。
sen.e: On April 1, 1935, Mizu-mura Tsuzuki-gun was merged into Yodo-cho.
On April 1, 1935, Mizu-mura Tsuzuki-gun was merged into Yodo-cho.
April 1, 1935: Mizu-mura, Tsuzuki-gun was merged into Yodo-cho.
sen.cmt: 同上カンマを追加しました。

sen.j: 1936年（昭和11年）2月11日 - 乙訓郡淀村を編入。
sen.e: On February 11, 1936, Yodo-mura Otokuni-gun was merged into Yodo-cho.
On February 11, 1936, Yodo-mura Otokuni-gun was merged into Yodo-cho.
February 11, 1936: Yodo-mura, Otokuni-gun was merged into Yodo-cho.
sen.cmt: 同上カンマを追加しました。

sen.j: 1957年（昭和32年）4月1日 - 京都市伏見区に編入。
sen.e: On April 1, 1956, Yodo-cho Kuse-gun was merged into Fushimi Ward Kyoto City Kyoto Prefecture.
On April 1, 1956, Yodo-cho Kuse-gun was merged into Fushimi Ward Kyoto City Kyoto Prefecture.
April 1, 1957: Yodo-cho, Kuse-gun was merged into Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 同上カンマを追加しました。年号を修正しました。

sen.j: 競馬ファンの間では淀競馬場あるいは単に淀と通称される。
sen.e: Some horse race fans nickname it Yodo race track or merely Yodo.
Some horse race fans nickname it Yodo race track or merely Yodo.
Some horse race fans nickname it Yodo race track or merely Yodo.

sen.j: 特に、この競馬場で実施されるGIレースの天皇賞、秋華賞、菊花賞、エリザベス女王杯、マイルチャンピオンシップの開催日には、全国の競馬ファンが多く詰め掛ける。
sen.e: It attracts many horse racing fans from all over the country particularly on days when G1 horse races are held--Tenno Sho, Shuka Sho, Kikuka Sho, Queen Elizabeth II Commemorative, and Mile Championship.

It attracts many horse racing fans from all over the country particularly on days when G1 horse races are held--Tenno Sho, Shuka Sho, Kikuka Sho, Queen Elizabeth II Commemorative, and Mile Championship.

It attracts many horse racing fans from all over the country particularly on days when G1 horse races are held--Tenno Sho, Shuka Sho, Kikuka Sho, Queen Elizabeth II Commemorative, and Mile Championship.

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道京阪本線 淀駅
sen.e: Yodo Station of the Keihan Electric Railway
Yodo Station of the Keihan Electric Railway
Yodo Station of the Keihan Electric Railway

sen.j: 旧京街道の宿場で、東海道五十三次に数えられることもある。
sen.e: Yodo-juku Station is one of the posting stations of Old Kyo-kaido Road and may be counted in the fifty-three stations of the Tokaido.
Yodo-juku Station is one of the posting stations of Old Kyo-kaido Road and may be counted in the fifty-three stations of the Tokaido.
Yodo-juku Station is one of the posting stations of Old Kyo Kaido Road and may be counted in the fifty-three stations of the Tokaido Road.

sen.j: 京都への道は伏見宿 (京街道)経由と、鴨川 (淀川水系) 沿いの鳥羽街道がある。
sen.e: There are two routes to Kyoto; one is via Fushimi-juku Station (Kyo Kaido Road) and the other is the Toba-kaido Road along the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System).
There are two routes to Kyoto; one is via Fushimi-juku Station (Kyo Kaido Road) and the other is the Toba-kaido Road along the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System).
There are two routes to Kyoto; one is via Fushimi-juku Station (Kyo Kaido Road) and the other is the Toba-kaido Road along the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system).
sen.cmt: system 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 東海道（京街道）
sen.e: Tokaido (Kyo Kaido Road)
Tokaido (Kyo Kaido Road)
Tokaido (Kyo Kaido Road)

sen.j: 伏見宿 (京街道) - 淀宿 - 枚方宿
sen.e: Fushimi-juku Station - Yodo-juku Station - Hirakata-juku Station
Fushimi-juku Station - Yodo-juku Station - Hirakata-juku Station
Fushimi-juku Station - Yodo-juku Station - Hirakata-juku Station
